Incident.Summary: A vehicle was stopped for an inoperable headlight. The odor of Cannabis was detected emitting from the vehicle. A probable cause search revealed a Cannabis less than 1.5 ounces.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: This incident was recorded on an in-car camera and body-worn camera system (H-21). Scene Processing: Upon contact with the vehicle and its driver, the sole occupant, I detected the strong odor of Cannabis emitting from the vehicle. The driver provided verbal consent to search his person which revealed one plastic baggie containing suspected Cannabis (Weight was 10.0 grams including baggie) recovered from the drivers left coat pocket. The subsequent search of the vehicle yielded negative results. No other CDS or contraband were located. The CDS was processed according to MSP policies and procedures, and stored in the Barrack H CDS Property Room. The CDS was recorded on a MSP Form 67, Chain of Custody, and on Property Record P-342579, and held at the Maryland State Police La Plata Barrack. Physical Evidence: The following item was recovered from the defendants person during a probable cause search and recorded on Property Held P-342579: One Ziploc bag A containing one plastic baggie and suspected Cannabis. Driver: Richardson, Ira Jerrell (DOB: 10/14/2000). Traffic Violations: TA 16-105(b1) Holder of learners permit driving without required supervision (2RW0T54). Safety Equipment Repair Order Headlights (S0T540KM). Civil Offense: CR 5-601(c)(2)ii(2) CDS-POSSESS-Cannabis under 1.5 ounces (Personal Use Amount) Tracking #6Z46644478 NARRATIVE: On Sunday, February 26, 2023, at approximately 0009 hours, I, TFC Foster #6937, while operating marked MSP patrol vehicle H-21, was working patrol in the area of southbound Mattawoman Beantown Road and Substation Road, Waldorf, Charles County, MD 20601. I observed a black passenger car traveling southbound, north of my location, with an inoperable passengers side headlight. I allowed the vehicle to pass my location, and I positioned my patrol vehicle behind it. While behind it, I observed the vehicle to be a black Kia Optima bearing Maryland Registration 2FD6563. I activated my emergency equipment and initiated a traffic stop on the Kia. The Kia pulled over onto the right shoulder of southbound Mattawoman Beantown Road just south of Mirkwood Lane. I made contact the driver of the Kia and stated the reason for the traffic stop. Upon contact, I immediately detected the strong odor of Cannabis emitting from the vehicle. I instructed the driver to retrieve his license and registration. The driver complied and I was able to identify him by his Maryland learners permit as Richardson, Ira Jerrell (DOB: 10/14/2000). I instructed Richardson to exit and come to the rear of his vehicle. At the rear of his vehicle, I explained to Richardson I detected the strong odor of Cannabis emitting from the vehicle. Richardson provided verbal consent to search his person. The search of Richardsons person revealed one plastic baggie containing suspected Cannabis, recovered from his left jacket pocket. The subsequent search of the vehicle, yielded negative results. No other CDS or Contraband was located. A MVA/NCIC/METERS check of Richardson revealed he had a learners permit only in Maryland. The Maryland State Police La Plata Barrack Police Communications Officer confirmed this. Richardson was issued a traffic citation for driving without required supervision, a safety equipment repair order for the inoperable headlight, and one Uniform Civil Citation (6Z46644478) for possession of a personal amount of Cannabis. After the traffic stop, the CDS was transported to the Maryland State Police La Plata Barrack for further processing. While at the Barrack, the CDS was weighed by Cpl. Gibson #5339. The weight of the suspected Cannabis, including the baggie, was 10.0 grams. Using a Nik Field Testing Kit, the CDS was tested and returned positive for the presence of THC (Tetrahydrocannabinol), the main and most active ingredient in Cannabis. I recognize the CDS to be Cannabis, a controlled dangerous substance, from my knowledge, training, and experience gained at the Maryland State Police Academy and from prior drug/CDS arrests/investigations. All events occurred in Charles County, MD. Case Closed.

IncidentProperty.Description: Item A - One ziploc bag A containing one plastic baggie with suspected Cannabis. (P-342579)
